intro: Gagea bracteolaris, commonly known as the bracteolaris spring beauty, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its bulbs are adapted for storing nutrients, allowing it to survive periods of dormancy. Gagea bracteolaris plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
